entry.title: Bolero 0.13 released
entry.summary: Updated to Blazor 3.2.0 final release, with improvements to server-side hosting and component attributes.

entry.title: Bolero 0.12 released
entry.summary: Updated for .NET Core 3.1 and Blazor 3.2, introducing lazy components, improved data binders, and more.

entry.title: Bolero 0.9 released
entry.summary: Release for .NET Core 3.0 RTM, introducing page models!

entry.title: Bolero 0.7 released
entry.summary: Updated for Blazor 3.0-preview7

entry.title: Bolero 0.5 released for Blazor 3.0-preview
entry.summary: Updated to the latest and greatest Blazor and .NET Core

entry.title: Bolero 0.4 released with remote authentication
entry.summary: Authenticate users and authorize remote functions with standard ASP.NET Core auth.

entry.title: Bolero 0.3 released with HTML template hot reloading
entry.summary: Designing a Bolero page is much quicker with HTML content live editing.

entry.title: Bolero 0.2 released with improved routing
entry.summary: You can now specify full path templates for routers.

entry.title: Announcing Bolero: F# tools for WebAssembly
entry.summary: A new library to create F# web applications in WebAssembly via Blazor.

entry.title: WebSharper 4.5.5 released
entry.summary: Introducing dynamic templates for WebSharper.UI

entry.title: WebSharper 4.5.4 released
entry.summary: This minor release adds sitelet CORS support, drops jQuery from UI's dependencies and fixes a number of issues.

entry.title: WebSharper 4.5.2 released with new AspNetCore API
entry.summary: This includes a more idiomatic API for WebSharper.AspNetCore.

entry.title: WebSharper.React: new and improved!
entry.summary: The new release makes it easy to use React in F#

entry.title: WebSharper 4.5 released
entry.summary: This release simplifies the use of HTML functions in WebSharper UI.

entry.title: WebSharper 4.4.1 released
entry.summary: This is a minor release for WebSharper and WebSharper.UI.

entry.title: WebSharper 4.4 released with Web Workers and Promises
entry.summary: This release improves client-side parallel and asynchronous programming in F# and C#.

entry.title: WebSharper 4.3 released with pure .NET Core support
entry.summary: With this release, mono is not required during compile time anymore.

entry.title: WebSharper 4.2.10 and UI 4.2.6 released
entry.summary: This minor release brings bug fixes and a few features to WebSharper and UI.

entry.title: WebSharper 4.2.9 released
entry.summary: This is a minor release for WebSharper and WebSharper.UI.

entry.title: WebSharper.UI 4.2.4 released
entry.summary: This is a minor feature release of WebSharper.UI, out-of-band from WebSharper.

entry.title: WebSharper 4.2.8 released with in-document template binding
entry.summary: The main highlight of this release is in-document template binding, a client-side feature which treats the whole document as a template to be filled.

entry.title: WebSharper 4 for ASP.NET MVC: new and improved
entry.summary: Today we are releasing WebSharper.AspNetMvc 4.2.0, with a simplified API.

entry.title: Clear and simple reactive code with WebSharper.UI's V
entry.summary: Reactive code can be just as clear and readable as static code with this new WebSharper.UI feature!

entry.title: WebSharper 4.2 released
entry.summary: It is finally here! Today we are releasing WebSharper 4.2.

entry.title: WebSharper 4.1.7 and 4.2.2-beta released
entry.summary: This is a bugfix release for both the stable and beta branches of WebSharper.

entry.title: WebSharper 4.1.3 released
entry.summary: This is a small bugfix release

entry.title: A simple OAuth application
entry.summary: I wrote a simple template application that you can use as a base to create your own OAuth-based app.

entry.title: Password-less authentication with WebSharper.OAuth
entry.summary: This tutorial shows how to authenticate a WebSharper Client-Server Application with an OAuth2 service and query its API.

entry.title: WebSharper 3.6.7 released
entry.summary: This is a minor release with bug fixes and updates for dependent libraries.

entry.title: WebSharper 3.6.6 released
entry.summary: This release adds a small client-side cookies library, a function to require resources in client-side markup, and various bug fixes.

entry.title: WebSharper 3.6 released with CDN support
entry.summary: We released WebSharper 3.6 which allows you to automatically point to our CDN for WebSharper libraries.

entry.title: WebSharper 3.5.16 released
entry.summary: WebSharper 3.5.16 splits off the WebSharper.Testing framework into a separate package and fixes a few bugs.

entry.title: WebSharper 3.5.13 released
entry.summary: This release adds Visual Studio 2015 Enterprise Edition support, and several bug fixes and minor features.

entry.title: WebSharper 3.5.9 released
entry.summary: This is mostly a bugfix release, with a few shorthands added to the UI.Next API.

entry.title: Announcing WebSharper.Suave
entry.summary: We are happy to announce the release of WebSharper.Suave, an adapter to run WebSharper applications on Suave.

entry.title: WebSharper 3.4.19 released
entry.summary: This new release of WebSharper adds the Xamarin Studio addin to the main release channel and introduces checked UI.Next number inputs, among many minor features and bug fixes.

entry.title: WebSharper.UI.Next 3.4.19 with OnAfterRender
entry.summary: This is a minor release of WebSharper UI.Next which provides the OnAfterRender feature from Html.Client.

entry.title: WebSharper 3.4.14 released
entry.summary: This release introduces features such as lenses to UI.Next and prepares the terrain for UI.Next versions of Formlets and Piglets.

entry.title: WebSharper 3.4 released
entry.summary: WebSharper 3.4 is out with a slew of features: new F# 4.0 collection functions, revamped sitelets API, anti-CSRF protection for RPC functions, and a reworked HTML language in UI.Next with server-side capability.

entry.title: WebSharper UI.Next 3.4: the new HTML syntax
entry.summary: In version 3.4, WebSharper UI.Next's markup has been overhauled in order to prepare for the upcoming merger into WebSharper in version 4.0.

entry.title: WebSharper 3.3 released with client-side JSON serialization
entry.summary: We just released WebSharper 3.3 with a new capability: Sitelets-compatible JSON serialization and deserialization on the client.

entry.title: WebSharper 3.2.22 released
entry.summary: This is a bugfix release including numerous fixes for compilation to JavaScript in Warp applications.

entry.title: WebSharper 3.1 published
entry.summary: The main highlights of this release are ASP.NET MVC support (including Razor pages), and a lighter syntax to embed client-side controls in sitelets.

entry.title: CloudSharper 0.9.31 published
entry.summary: This release updates CloudSharper to use WebSharper 3.1.

entry.title: WebSharper: From Zero to an Azure-deployed Web Application
entry.summary: Find out how to easily set up a WebSharper application for deployment to Azure.

entry.title: WebSharper 3.0.59 released
entry.summary: This minor release adds Sitelets-related functionality and bug fixes.

entry.title: WebSharper 3.0 RC released
entry.summary: We are finally closing in on the final WebSharper 3.0 with this release candidate.

entry.title: CloudSharper 0.9.29 released
entry.summary: CloudSharper 0.9.29 is out, with UI enhancements and a number of fixes to the editor.

entry.title: WebSharper 3.0-alpha for Xamarin Studio / MonoDevelop is now available!
entry.summary: We have updated the WebSharper Xamarin Studio / MonoDevelop add-in for the latest WebSharper 3.0.36-alpha.It is now easier than ever to get started with WebSharper 3.0 on Mac or Linux!

entry.title: Upcoming in WebSharper 3.0: serving REST APIs, easy as pie!
entry.summary: WebSharper 3.0 is coming with an awesome new feature: automatically parse JSON requests into typed F# values, and reply with JSON just as easily!

entry.title: CloudSharper 0.9.27 released
entry.summary: CloudSharper 0.9.27 is out, with some UI enhancements and the capability to write WebSharper RPC methods in F# interactive.

entry.title: CloudSharper 0.9.26 released
entry.summary: This new CloudSharper version includes an HTTP API to create a workspace in a single click.

entry.title: CloudSharper 0.9.25 released
entry.summary: This release of CloudSharper updates the templates and the user interface itself to the latest WebSharper.

entry.title: WebSharper 3.0.8-alpha published
entry.summary: This release of WebSharper streamlines a lot of the namespaces, making it more intuitive to use than ever. It is a breaking update, and this article describes all the (mostly trivial) changes that need to be done to existing projects.

entry.title: CloudSharper 0.9.23 released
entry.summary: CloudSharper updates to WebSharper 3.0 alpha.

entry.title: News from WebSharper 3.0: NuGet, Visual Studio, Mono, upcoming features and API changes
entry.summary: The first batch of WebSharper 3.0 releases has just hit NuGet, together with the Visual Studio extension. The build system has been updated to build correctly on Mono. Work has also started on new features and API enhancements.

entry.title: WebSharper migration to GitHub complete!
entry.summary: WebSharper sources and issues have moved from BitBucket to GitHub.

entry.title: CloudSharper 0.9.20.3 released
entry.summary: This release of CloudSharper adds configuration options for the local service's web server and the workspaces directory.

entry.title: CloudSharper 0.9.19.3 released
entry.summary: This is a bugfix release focusing mainly on the F# code service.

entry.title: CloudSharper 0.9.19.1 released
entry.summary: Just a few hours after releasing CloudSharper 0.9.19.0, we are back with a handful of small enhancements.

entry.title: CloudSharper 0.9.17.1 released
entry.summary: This release enables running F# interactive without a workspace, in addition to a set of bug fixes.

entry.title: CloudSharper 0.9.17 released
entry.summary: This is a minor bugfix release.

entry.title: CloudSharper 0.9.16.1 released
entry.summary: This is a minor bugfix release of CloudSharper Local alpha.

entry.title: CloudSharper 0.9.16 released
entry.summary: This release marks the first of many upcoming features to customize your environment.

entry.title: CloudSharper 0.9.14 released
entry.summary: This release is geared towards enhanced usability with two main features: a reworked dashboard and a new solution view.

entry.title: CloudSharper 0.9.13 with workspace cloud sharing!
entry.summary: With this new release of CloudSharper, we are starting the move of CloudSharper towards more and more online publication and sharing capabilities.

entry.title: CloudSharper 0.9.12
entry.summary: Version 0.9.12 of CloudSharper alpha is out!

entry.title: CloudSharper 0.9.11.2
entry.summary: This is a bugfix release.

entry.title: CloudSharper 0.9.11.1
entry.summary: This is a bugfix version after yesterday's bigger release.

entry.title: CloudSharper 0.9.11
entry.summary: Version 0.9.11 of CloudSharper alpha is out!

entry.title: WebSharper Binding for Leaflet released
entry.summary: We are happy to announce the release of a WebSharper binding for Leafletjs, a library that makes it easy to display and work with maps such as OpenStreetMap.

entry.title: CloudSharper Local alpha 0.9.10.2
entry.summary: This minor release of CloudSharper alpha focuses on a few long-standing bug fixes, as well as the addition of the "Search and replace" functionality in the editor.

entry.title: CloudSharper 0.9.9.2
entry.summary: A bugfix release of CloudSharper in preparation for the upcoming remote multi-user server feature.

entry.title: CloudSharper 0.9.9.1
entry.summary: This is a bugfix release, the most important fix being the fsi interactive features.

entry.title: F# query expressions and composability
entry.summary: F# 3.x Query Expressions are a nice piece of syntactic sugar, but they are notably difficult to compose. This article discusses the auto-quoting mechanism of query expressions and how it can be leveraged to implement not-too-clunky composition.

entry.title: CloudSharper Local alpha 0.9.6
entry.summary: In addition to several bug fixes, the main highlight of this new update is the experimental support for MSBuild as an alternative to IntelliFactory.Build.

entry.title: CloudSharper Local alpha 0.9.5
entry.summary: Today's update features an enhanced installer, smoother Markdown and HTML editing, and some more bug fixes.

entry.title: CloudSharper Updates - Friday, February 14, 2014
entry.summary: One day since the first alpha release, and already the first bug reports -- and fixes.

entry.title: XML computation expressions: Playing around with extending the F# compiler
entry.summary: Existing embedded DSLs for XML in F# all have their quirks and inconvenients. I'm presenting a small patch to the F# compiler that allows to implement a better XML EDSL.

entry.title: New FPish feature: E-mail notification
entry.summary: FPish can now alert you by e-mail of responses to your FPish submissions!

entry.title: WebSharper for Windows 8 Desktop
entry.summary: The first Windows 8 Application developed with WebSharper is about to go live on the Windows Store. This is a preview of the upcoming WebSharper WinJS binding.

entry.title: Building UIs for WebSharper with ExtJS Architect
entry.summary: WebSharper provides an extension to write ExtJS applications in F#. But did you know that you can easily use the visual designer ExtJS Architect in conjunction with WebSharper? Here is how.

entry.title: Latest FPish enhancements
entry.summary: We recently rolled out a few enhancements on FPish. The main highlights are blog comments and tweet functionality.

entry.title: FPish now hosts blogs!
entry.summary: Since the beginning FPish has allowed Authors to aggregate their blogs. We are now going a step further by allowing you to write blog articles on FPish.

entry.title: WebSharper Extensions for Bing Maps 7.0 Updated
entry.summary: The WebSharper Extensions for Bing Maps has been updated to reflect the last changes in the 7.0 API. Among notable additions are Directions, a simplified interface to the Routes REST API, Traffic and VenueMaps, as well as the possibility to implement your own extension modules.

entry.title: Color the Wind - a 2D Canvas demo with WebSharper
entry.summary: At DemoJS, a demoparty dedicated to web technologies that took place this weekend in Paris, a demo coded with WebSharper was released.

entry.title: WebSharper / O3D sample: Snooker game
entry.summary: We translated the snooker game sample from the official O3D website to WebSharper. The result is on par with the original in terms of performance, with 25% shorter source code and extra code safety.

entry.title: O3D Extension for WebSharper available
entry.summary: In our continuing effort to make the most powerful JavaScript tools available to WebSharper developers, we are releasing the extension for Google O3D. O3D is a 3D programming library built on top of WebGL, enabling high-level resource and rendering management for 3D scenes.

entry.title: DHTMLX Touch for WebSharper available
entry.summary: Today we are happy to announce the release of a new extension for WebSharper: DHTMLX Touch. This library provides a complete set of UI widgets, alongside a number of tools to seamlessly connect them to application data, resulting in web applications with an impressive native feel.

entry.title: WebGL and glMatrix Extensions for WebSharper Released
entry.summary: Today we are happy to announce the release of not one, but two new WebSharper extensions: WebGL and glMatrix. Together, they bring the power of hardware-accelerated 3D into WebSharper.

entry.title: Bing Maps 7.0 Extension for WebSharper
entry.summary: The Bing Maps extension for WebSharper has been updated to version 7.0 of the library. It allows developers to use the latest features of Bing Maps, including info boxes and keyboard events. It also provides a convenient interface to the REST API for searches, routes and static map images.
